text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale, today I'm going
to show you something that's going to take

absolutely no time, but this is what's going
to kick up your ice cream game quite a few
notches this summer!

I'm going to show you how to make magic shell,
also known as dip top, or a hard shell - it

doesn't matter, it's basically that chocolate
sauce that as soon as it hits that cold ice

cream it hardens and it's so much fun, it's
so fabulous, it takes just two ingredients,

you can use this sauce to doctor up some store
bought ice cream, to have some fun with your

kids, some fun with your thirty something
year old husband because he loves magic shell,
and I do too.

But it's really fun and it's really easy and
I'm just excited to share it with you and

like I said it's going to take you two minutes
but it's awesome.
You'll need two ingredients.
Semisweet chocolate chips.
and some coconut oil.

This is not candle wax, Joe was asking why
there was candle wax in my bowl, it's coconut

oil and when coconut oil isn't heated it solidifies,
so once we introduce it to some heat it is

going to melt and become luxurious and beautiful
and perfect and wonderful.

Now, I have tried making this with some milk
chocolate and I've also tried making this
with some bittersweet chocolate.

I felt like the milk chocolate was just really,
really sweet, and the bittersweet chocolate
was a little bit too bitter.

So I find that semisweet chocolate is just
like perfect for this so that's why I'm excited
to share it with you.
Like I said, two ingredients and that's it.

You can do this one of a few ways, you can
take this mixture, put it in a large microwave

safe bowl and pop it in the microwave until
everything is melted, or you can do this over

a double boiler, you can put a little bit
of water in the bottom of a pan, but a heat

safe bowl on top and heat it up until everything
melts.

Or, if you're a daredevil like me, I'm going
to go ahead and put everything into a saucepan

and cook it over low heat, you don't want
to do it over medium, you don't want to do

it over high heat because it will scorch and
you want to make sure that does not happen.

So I've got my coconut oil, my chocolate chips
over my stovetop as low as it will go and

I am just going to cook this until everything
melts together, and that is it, I can't wait

to show you what it is like when we pour it
over our ice cream.
Ay oh!

That looks perfect, I've got my ice cream
in my little cups, I actually served these

up and popped these in the freezer just so
that they would stay nice and cool, then you
take a small ladle.

Hold on let me move this guy because I can
just foresee that flying all over the place.

And then you take your sauce and you just
pour over the top and in a few seconds you'll

see what happens, just give it time and if
you think to yourself 'oh that's not working'

just give it a few seconds and then you'll
see the magic.

And then you can top it with some nuts or
whatever your heart desires but look, you
see that?

And then you do that and that is your magic
shell.
Dip top.

Whatever you call it, I don't really care
it's just awesome!
It's cold though!
Really cold.

That is Summer on the Jersey boardwalk with
an ice cream cone in your hand, dip top, whatever

you want to call it just dripping over the
side and hardening as you're eating it.

It is perfection and I hope that you make
this this weekend, I know it is not a recipe

but I want ed to share it with you because
it's so fun, it's so fun to do it with a group

of people, you can do it on ice cream cones,
you can do it individually, you can do whatever
your heart desires it's just so fun.

Go make it this weekend, I will have the recipe
written down on LauraintheKitchen.com for
reference.
Look at this.
It's just so fun!

Hope you've enjoyed spending time with me,
I'll see you next time!
I'm going to eat all the magic shell!
